meanings.def: a person who is not a citizen of the country in which they live or work
examples: an illegal alien
During the war, he was imprisoned as an enemy alien.
It is illegal for employers to hire aliens not authorized for employment.
The provisions would broaden the government's ability to deport aliens.
aliens from outer space
Do you genuinely believe that space aliens have landed on our planet?
Few movies represent intelligent aliens as physically different from humans.
He was convinced that he'd been abducted by aliens.
In the movie aliens invade Earth.

meanings.def: strange and frightening; different from what you are used to
examples: an alien environment
In a world that had suddenly become alien and dangerous, he was her only security.

meanings.def: from another country or society; foreign
examples: an alien culture
alien influences that threatened their way of life
A part of me still feels alien in this country.
His last years were spent alone and insecure in an alien land.
The peasants had kept an oral tradition alive during centuries of domination by alien cultures.
Native woodland was destroyed and alien conifers were planted.
alien to somebody/something The idea is alien to our religion.
A referendum is alien to the party’s concept of democracy.
Cruelty was quite alien to him.

meanings.def: connected with creatures from another world
examples: alien beings from outer space
